item.title: A divided Fed cuts interest rates for third straight time
item.description: The Federal Reserve voted to cut its benchmark interest rate on Wednesday. This was the Fed's third rate cut since September, but policymakers signaled they expect to make fewer rate cuts next year.
item.content:encoded: The Federal Reserve voted to cut its benchmark interest rate on Wednesday. This was the Fed's third rate cut since September, but policymakers signaled they expect to make fewer rate cuts next year.

item.title: Can the lessons of 1929 help us avert another economic crisis?
item.description: New York Times financial columnist Andrew Ross Sorkin draws parallels between the stock market crash of 1929, which led to the Great Depression, and today's economic uncertainty.

item.title: The Fed is expected to cut rates. And, Afghan CIA fighters feel abandoned by the U.S.
item.description: The divided Federal Reserve is considering cutting interest rates today. And, Afghans in the U.S. who fought for the CIA say they feel abandoned by the agency.

item.title: A divided Federal Reserve cuts interest rates for a 3rd straight time
item.description: The Fed lowered its benchmark interest rate by a quarter percentage point, in an effort to shore up a weakening job market. With inflation remaining stubbornly high, it was not a slam dunk decision.

item.title: China's trade surplus hits $1 trillion for first time ever
item.description: China's exports to the U.S. have dropped sharply this year, in the face of President Trump's tariffs — but the country is still finding plenty of customers elsewhere around the world.
